Etymology.
nigrofemorata
, feminine adjective, from L. nigrum , black, and L. femur , leg, in reference to femur of each metathoracic leg black distally.

Diagnosis. Distal half of femur of each metathoracic leg black. Male genitalia: lateral angles of ventral rim of pygophore projected posteriorly; ventral rim with an acute process medially; head of each paramere quadrate, covering segment X basally; each posterolateral angle of segment X produced, acute apically. Female genitalia: posterior margins of gonocoxites 8 sinuate, somewhat reflexed; gonocoxites 9 swollen, strongly convex, higher in profile than gonocoxites 8 .

Description. Meso- and metapleura mostly black, with yellow longitudinal stripe mesially; legs yellow, area surrounding each setae brown, distal half of femur of each metathoracic leg black; disc of scutellum black. Urosternites mostly black, castaneous on and around tubercle on urosternite III; lateral portion of each urosternite yellow, distal angle outlined in black. Inner margin of each connexival sclerite black, outer margin yellow. Proportion of antennal segments: I <II = III <IV = V.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 9 – 12.
Genitalia of
Elanela nigrofemorata
sp. nov. 9
– 10
, pygophore in dorsal and ventral views, respectively; 11 , female genital plates in posteroventral view; 12 , female receptaculum seminis and ausenwand. Abbreviations: cs, capsula seminalis; dr, ductus receptaculli; g9, gonapophyses 9; gc8, gonocoxites 8, gc9, gonocoxites 9; la8, laterotergite 8; la9, laterotergite 9; pa, paramere; X, abdominal segment X; tvi, thickening of vaginal intima; va, vesicular area; vr, ventral rim. Scale bars = 0.5 mm.
